v.v: Woe to Ariel, Ariel, the city where David encamped!
But I will besiege Ariel, and she will be mourning and lamenting;
I will encamp against you in a circle
You will be brought down and will speak from the ground; your speech will be low from the dust.
The great number of your invaders will become like fine dust, and the multitude of the ruthless ones as chaff that passes away.
Yahweh of hosts will come to you
It will be like a dream, a vision of the night:
It will be like when a hungry man dreams he is eating, but when he awakes, his stomach is empty.
Astonish yourselves and be astonished; blind yourselves and be blind!
For Yahweh has poured out on you the spirit of deep sleep.
All revelation has become to you as the words of a book that is sealed, which men might give to one who is learned, saying, “Read this.” He also says, “I cannot, for it is sealed.”
If the book is given to one who cannot read, saying, “Read this,” he says, “I cannot read.”
The Lord said, “This people comes close to me with their mouths
Therefore, see, I will proceed to do a marvelous thing among this people, wonder after wonder.
Woe to those who deeply hide their plans from Yahweh,
You turn things upside down! Should the potter be considered like clay,
In just a little while,
On that day the deaf will hear the words of a book,
The oppressed will again rejoice in Yahweh,
For the ruthless will cease, and the scoffer will vanish. All those who love to do evil will be eliminated,
who by a word make a man out to be an offender. They lay a snare for him
Therefore this is what Yahweh says concerning the house of Jacob—Yahweh, who redeemed Abraham,
But when he sees his children, the work of my hands, they will make my name holy.
Those who err in spirit will gain understanding, and complainers will learn knowledge.”

v: Add year to year; let the festivals come round.
and she will be to me like Ariel.
and will lay siege against you with a palisade, and I will raise siege works against you.
Your voice will sound like a spirit that speaks from the ground, and out of the dust your speech will whisper.
It will happen suddenly, in an instant.
with thunder, earthquake, great noise, with strong winds and violent storm, and the flames of a devouring fire.
A horde of all the nations will fight against Ariel
and her stronghold. They will attack her and her fortifications to press upon her.
It will be like when a thirsty man dreams that he is drinking, but he when he awakes, he is fainting, with his thirst not quenched.
Yes, so will be the great number of nations that fights against Mount Zion.
Be drunk, but not with wine; stagger, but not with beer.
He has closed your eyes, the prophets, and has covered your heads, the seers.
and honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.
Their honor for me is only a commandment of men that has been taught.
The wisdom of their wise men will perish, and the understanding of their prudent men will disappear.”
and whose deeds are in darkness. They say, “Who sees us, and who knows us?”
so that the thing that is made should say about him who made it, “He did not make me,”
or the thing formed say about him who formed it, “He does not understand”?
Lebanon will be turned into a field, and the field will become a forest.
and the eyes of the blind will see out of the deep darkness.
and the poor among men will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
who seeks justice at the gate and put the righteous down with empty lies.
“Jacob will no longer be ashamed, nor will his face be pale.
They will make holy the name of the Holy One of Jacob and they will stand in awe of the God of Israel.
